Posted By: Kyzar (4/30/2011 3:52:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
One of my favorite cards ever printed. I love everything about this, especially the incredible artwork that manages to be both elegantly beautiful and disturbingly creepy. I was lucky enough to open one and she has massacred many a swarm ever since.  
  
Tournament value? I haven't seen any yet, but who knows what innistrad may bring. It is obviously a graveyard-related block, so reanimating her quickly might be something we experience often come september 2011.  
  
One final note: does anyone look at this card and see foreshadowing of a war between phyrexia and the eldrazi? From the ability to the flavor text, i think i have gained future sight.
posts.html:
One of my favorite cards ever printed. I love everything about this, especially the incredible artwork that manages to be both elegantly beautiful and disturbingly creepy. I was lucky enough to open one and she has massacred many a swarm ever since.

Tournament value? I haven't seen any yet, but who knows what innistrad may bring. It is obviously a graveyard-related block, so reanimating her quickly might be something we experience often come september 2011.

One final note: does anyone look at this card and see foreshadowing of a war between phyrexia and the eldrazi? From the ability to the flavor text, i think i have gained future sight.

Posted By: Laguz (7/29/2011 3:19:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
That is not a hat.  
  
That is her face.  
  
**THAT IS HER FACE.**  
  
... that's scary. See also [Marrow Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow Shards).  
  
...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.  
  
It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)
posts.html:
That is not a hat.

That is her face.

THAT IS HER FACE.

... that's scary. See also Marrow Shards.

...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.

It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)

posts.post_content:
@Arachnos, [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite) beats [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) and [Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger) in combat. Due to Norn's effect, Sheoldred becomes a 4/4 and Vorniclex becomes a 5/4 while Norn remains a 4/7 (Alive and **untapped**. She's one bad momma.   
  
Also, good luck playing Army of the Damned (with or without flashback) while this beauty is in standard.

Posted By: TheDarkLight (5/29/2011 12:29:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this gal is my favorite Praetor. No contest.  
  
She is the paragon of Phyrexia, that corrupts everything it touches. It's like the beauty and elegance of White were twisted, mutilated and deformed to give birth to her. This flowing silken gown, this elegant demeanor on a being that looks like a perversion of everything that is female, a Barbie doll straight out of a madman's fever dream. For the people out there who make fun of her faceplate, remember that she leads a mockery of a religion and as such it makes sense she would wear a ridiculously exaggerated hat. Pope hats are extravagant enough on their own.  
  
She embodies the ideal of White, to defend and protect, but she embodies it *wrong*. She shelters her own but simultaneously breaks down her opponent, a very Black shtick, that. Quite Phyrexian.  
  
And then there's the whole backstory about her and the sickening parody of a "religion" she leads, the Machine Orthodoxy.  
  
Very eerie and very Phyrexian. More so than any of th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Axelle (11/14/2011 4:08:57 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @Dexal: You're overlooking a lot of flavor text. Urabrask hates all of the other Praetors' guts and actually lets the Mirran resistance live in his territory, while refusing the other Phyrexian factions entry. Plus Red Phyrexians, due to the highly individual-based nature of Red mana, are capable of feeling compassion and other such emotions. On top of this, Jin-Gitaxias and Vorinclex can't stand each other. Elesh Norn's and Sheoldred's goals seem to be pretty contradictory to each other. Jin and Elesh, while staunchly allied on the face, don't seem to trust each other completely. I'm willing to bet that we will return to Mirrodin one day, and there will be a New Phyrexian Civil War. And it will be glorious.
posts.html:
@Dexal: You're overlooking a lot of flavor text. Urabrask hates all of the other Praetors' guts and actually lets the Mirran resistance live in his territory, while refusing the other Phyrexian factions entry. Plus Red Phyrexians, due to the highly individual-based nature of Red mana, are capable of feeling compassion and other such emotions. On top of this, Jin-Gitaxias and Vorinclex can't stand each other. Elesh Norn's and Sheoldred's goals seem to be pretty contradictory to each other. Jin and Elesh, while staunchly allied on the face, don't seem to trust each other completely. I'm willing to bet that we will return to Mirrodin one day, and there will be a New Phyrexian Civil War.
